PPLoc: Covers HR and vendor data only - available on organization's Intranet and from local HR representatives
activities: HUMAN RESOURCES AND VENDOR/LICENSEE DATA (RELATING TO EMPLOYEES AND OTHER PERSONNEL) STORED WITHIN AND/OR PROCESSED BY OR IN CONNECTION WITH: System for providing and managing employee training (Skillport); Systems relating to career and succession planning, administering employee contracts, employee evaluations, implementing employee-related actions and obligations and calculating and providing employment benefits, bonuses and compensation (Total Rewards Planning, Role Mapping and Eligibility Database, Fix ‘n’ Flex); The roll-out, management and, administration of Warner’s Standards of Business Conduct and associated training (NYSE Governance Services); Systems for Human Resources management and employee data management (Peoplesoft, My Contacts, Pictures International Directory, Workday); System relating to recruitment and hiring activities (BrassRing); Business continuity and disaster recovery systems (MessageOne, WB Alerts, WBREADY); Tracking, reporting and managing ethics and compliance (Navex Global); Tracking and reporting conflicts of interest (Remedy, HR COI Tracking Database); Managing electronic discovery in connection with litigation (Clearwell); Expense and travel management system (Concur); System for tracking and approval of Company purchases (PCard); Payment of reimbursed employee expenses (i.e., non-payroll payments) and management and the payment of certain independent contractors’ invoices (SAP); Systems for calculating and paying residual payments owed to employee participants (AIRS, Sylvester); Human resources case management and solution system (Remedy, Conflict of Interest Database (global), Conflict of Interest Database (EMEA)); Global payroll management system (SafeGuard); System enabling enterprise collaboration including document sharing (Corporate SharePoint 2010); Storage and distribution of internal (i.e. intra-group) emails (Exchange mailbox servers and Exchange SMTP relay servers); Systems for managing and authenticating access to Warner’s systems and networks (Active Directory, Enterprise Single Sign On, PASSPORT); and System for managing and processing employee forms (e.g., service requests for IT equipment or building access and employee questionnaires) (eForms); System for archiving historical data (Archive Reporting Portal); Systems for storage of Legal Department contracts, documents, work products and information (ENTERPRISE DOCS, LAW MANAGER (LIBRARIES)); Systems for managing Management Information Systems projects  (CLARITY, RESOURCE HUB); Product release, performance tracking, forecasting and executive reporting systems (EIS3, SIEBEL INTERNATIONAL); System for management of global supply chain for manufactured goods (INCEPTION); Data exchange systems for  business partner data enabling reporting, forecasting, invoice generation and financial reconciliation (LICENSEE DATA EXCHANGE, RIM); Contract management system to create and track licensing contracts (COSMOS, LMSI); Systems for management of packaging artwork and digital assets (BA LINK, BAT-LINK, BRIAN, iCampaign, WBDA, ODYSSEY); TV and theatrical production accounting systems (VISTA); home video and digital title rights release tracking system (RRTS); and music sales reporting and royalty calculation system (Counterpoint).

corpofftitle1: Senior Vice President and Chief Privacy Officer

personaldata: Organization data.  Yes, the data covered includes manually processed data.
